page.title: 03ECOLOGY
page.content: {SPROTBOROUGH FLASH Sprotborough Flash is unlike most man-made lakes as it was not built deliberately. Disused local colliery seams below the{River Don}subsided, and in the winter of 1924 flooded. {Sprotborough Flash}was born. Later the river level was raised to improve navigation, the{Flash}became deeper and flooded more of the surrounding land. {Today Sprotborough Flash}has been developed from a damp field beside the{River Don}to an area rich in wild flowers and birds. The site lies in the{Don Valley}three miles upstream from{Doncaster. }The {Yorkshire Wildlife Trust}administer the site as a{nature reserve.
